body_html: You could argue that 0 is exceedingly rare, but I think it is good practice to cover the half-open interval [0,1) with equally half-open bins [a,b), which is what the ge achieves (and the gt seems to stem from the time when the uniform random number was in fact in (0,1]).
body_text: You could argue that 0 is exceedingly rare, but I think it is good practice to cover the half-open interval [0,1) with equally half-open bins [a,b), which is what the ge achieves (and the gt seems to stem from the time when the uniform random number was in fact in (0,1]).
body: You could argue that 0 is exceedingly rare, but I think it is good practice to cover the half-open interval [0,1) with equally half-open bins [a,b), which is what the ge achieves (and the gt seems to stem from the time when the uniform random number was in fact in (0,1]).
